content: Search Free Trial Get Demo Data443 Reports Third Quarter 2022 Results and Provides Corporate Update November 15, 2022 Research Triangle Park, NC, Nov. 15, 2022  Data443 Risk Mitigation, Inc . Data443 OTCPK ATDS, a data security and privacy software company for ALL THINGS DATA SECURITY, today announced operating results for the third quarter and first nine months ended September 30, 2022. Business Accomplishments and Highlights for the First Nine Months of 2022 Retained 99 of its customers despite economic conditions Announced new headquarters in Research Triangle Park, North Carolina Appointed finance, MA, and compliance veteran Greg McCraw to the position of Chief Financial Officer Appointed IP Leader Pamela Maher to the position of Chief Legal Officer Increased global product and brand visibility, attending 4 in-person trade shows Acquisitions Acquired ransomware protection and device recovery technology assets from Centurion Technologies Contracts Secured multiyear agreements For our Data443  Data Placement Manager technology solution, with a Fortune 500 Fintech company and with a leading Puerto Rico financial services organization For our Data443  Data Identification Manager product, with a global international bank to support their cloud-first strategy for rapidly migrating their data and user base to the cloud For our Data443  Data Archive Manager product, with a leading insurance organization so they can discover, analyze and migrate complex datasets to Microsoft 365  . Product Updates Released Data443  Antivirus Protection Manager, our new antivirus product for desktops, laptops, virtual desktops, database engines running Microsoft Windows  , for standard servers or cloud instances, such as Microsoft Azure  , Amazon Web Services  , Google Cloud Platform  , as well as hybrid on-premisescloud instances Announced Data443  Antivirus Protection Manager earned the prestigious VB100 Certification from Virus Bulletin. Announced support from the Gartner Security  Risk Management Summit 2022 for our Data443  Data Identification Manager Hybrid Classifications Taxonomy data platform Announced support for Data443  Data Placement Manager product for commercial and open-source versions of leading Unix implementations on all major cloud services vendors  including Microsoft Azure, Amazon Web Services, and Google Cloud Platform, Management Commentary Data443 CEO  Founder Jason Remillard observed, Our results for the third quarter came in largely as expected, and we continue to see high revenue customer retention amidst extremely challenging economic conditions. We continue to focus on realigning our current customer relationships to a subscription and monthly recurring revenue model. While this has affected straight line revenue growth year-over-year, our increased and growing deferred revenues, diverse revenue base, and increased analyst attention all demonstrate the strong momentum of our business. Looking ahead, we anticipate ending 2022 on a high note as we continue to work and deliver on renewals and net new opportunities with customers. We continue to expand the adoption of our product sets in some of the worlds largest organizations, supporting business critical data in flight and at rest, in the cloud or on premises. I am confident that Data443 is well positioned to make the most of the substantial market opportunity before us, continuing our mission T o o rganize the worlds information by identifying and protecting all sensitive data regardless of location, platform , or format , concluded Mr. Remillard. Thir d Quarter 2022 Financial Highlights Total revenues were 916,172 during the three months ended September 30, 2022, compared to 1,495,059 of revenue for the three months ended September 30, 2021, a decrease of 39. The decrease in revenue in the second quarter was primarily due to our ongoing shift for some products from one-time sales perpetual licenses with annual maintenance contracts to time-based subscriptions with multiyear upfront payments this shift resulted in fewer customers paying for subscriptions or renewals in the quarter. General and administrative expenses for the quarter ended September 30, 2022, were 1,579,529, compared to 1,065,619 for the quarter ended September 30, 2021, an increase of 48. The increase in general and administrative expense primarily consisted of management costs, costs to integrate assets we acquired and to expand sales, product enhancements, audit and review fees, filing fees, professional fees, and other expenses related to SEC reporting, including the re-classification of sales-related management expenses, in connection with the projected growth of our business. Additionally, we continue to incur specific one-time costs in relation to our planned Nasdaq Capital Markets uplist, additional financing activities and related functions, and an increase in other professional service fees. The net loss for the quarter ended September 30, 2022 was 1,582,720, compared to a loss of 974,124 for the quarter ended September 30, 2021 it was mainly derived from an operating loss of 786,663, and interest expense of 796,057. The net loss for the quarter ended September 30, 2021 was mainly derived from an operating income of 195,985, interest expense of 1,101,910 and loss on change in fair value of derivative liability of 68,199. Financial Highlights for the Nine Months Ended September 30, 2022 Total revenues were 2,279,677 during the nine months ended September 30, 2022, compared to 3,095,279 of revenue for the nine months ended September 30, 2021. The decrease in revenue for the nine months ended September 30, 2022 was primarily due to increased pull-through of deals in Q4 of 2021  both by the Company and our customers who took advantage of prepaid multi-year discounts and also took advantage of multi-year commitments to our SaaS products and other software product offerings. Total deferred revenues were 2,652,382 as of September 30, 2022, compared with 1,608,596 of deferred revenues as of December 31, 2021  representing an increase of 65. General and administrative expenses for the nine months ended September 30, 2022 were 4,669,311, compared to 3,810,580 for the nine months ended September 30, 2021, an increase of 22. The increase in general and administrative expenses primarily consisted of management costs, costs to integrate assets we acquired and to expand sales, product enhancements, audit and review fees, filing fees, professional fees, and other expenses related to SEC reporting, including the reclassification of sales-related management expenses, in connection with the projected growth of our business. Additionally, we continue to incur specific one-time costs in relation to our planned uplist to the Nasdaq Capital Markets, additional financing activities, and related functions. The net loss for the nine months ended September 30, 2022, was 5,862,251 compared to a loss of 4,695,776 for the nine months ended September 30, 2021. It was mainly derived from an operating loss of 2,971,242, and interest expense of 2,833,126. The net loss for the nine months ended September 30, 2021 was mainly derived from a loss on change in fair value of derivative liability of 431,853 and interest expense of 2,678,198 associated with convertible notes payable and convertible preferred stock, and gross margins of 1,919,028 and 2,687,175, offset in part by general and administrative, and sales and marketing expenses incurred. About Data443 Risk Mitigation, Inc. Data443 Risk Mitigation, Inc. OTC ATDS provides software and services to enable secure data across devices and databases, at rest and in flightin transit, locally, on a network, or in the cloud. We are All Things Data Security. With over 10,000 customers in over 100 countries, Data443 provides a modern approach to data governance and security by identifying and protecting all sensitive data regardless of location, platform, or format. Our framework helps customers prioritize risk, identify security gaps, and implement effective data protection and privacy management strategies. Forward-Looking Statements This press release contains forward-looking statements. These statements are made under the safe harbor provisions of the U.S. Private Securities Litigation Reform Act of 1995. Forward-looking statements may be identified by use of terms such as expect, believe, anticipate, may, could, will, should, plan, project, intend, estimate, predict, potential, pursuant, target, continue, or the negative of these words or other comparable terminology. Statements in this press release that are not historical statements, including statements regarding Data443s plans, objectives, future opportunities for Data443s services, future financial performance and operating results and any other statements regarding Data443s future expectations, beliefs, plans, objectives, financial conditions, assumptions or future events or performance, are forward-looking statements. These statements are not guarantees of future performance and are subject to numerous risks, uncertainties, and assumptions, many of which are difficult to predict or are beyond Data443s control. These risks, uncertainties, and assumptions could cause actual results to differ materially from the results expressed or implied by the statements. They may relate to the outcome of litigation, settlements and investigations, actions by third parties, including governmental agencies, volatility in customer spending, global economic conditions, inability to hire and retain personnel, loss of, or reduction in business with, key customers, difficulty with growth and integration of acquisitions, product liability cybersecurity risk, anti-takeover measures in our charter documents,and the uncertainties created by global health issues, such as the ongoing outbreak of COVID, and political unrest and conflict, such as the invasion of Ukraine by Russia. These and other important risk factors are described more fully in our reports and other documents filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission the SEC, including in Part I, Item 1A of our Annual Report on Form 10-K filed with the SEC on March 31, 2022 and our subsequent filings with the SEC. Undue reliance should not be placed on the forward-looking statements in this press release, which are based on information available to us on the date hereof. Except as otherwise required by applicable law, we undertake no obligation to publicly update or revise any forward-looking statements, whether because of new information, future events, or otherwise. DATA443 is a registered trademark of Data443 Risk Mitigation, Inc. All product names, trademarks and registered trademarks are property of their respective owners. All company, product and service names used in this press release are for identification purposes only. Use of these names, trademarks and brands does not imply endorsement. For f urther i nformation Follow us on Twitter  Follow us on Facebook  Follow us on LinkedIn  Follow us on YouTube  Signup for our Investor Newsletter  Investor Relations Contact Matthew Abenante  919.858.6542 Try it for Free Instant Data Classification Cyren URL Category Chacker Prev Data443 To Expand Research Triangle Park Footprint as First Tenant for Horseshoe at Hub RTP Facilities Data443 Expands Data Security Offerings with New Webex Integration Next Company Partners Resources Investor Relations Products Freeware Demo Solutions Contact Us Privacy Management Service by Data443

analyses.comprehensive:
### Comprehensive Analysis of Security-Related Content

#### 1. **Key Security Features and Their Benefits to Users**

The content highlights several security features provided by Data443 Risk Mitigation, Inc. that directly benefit users. These features include:

- **Antivirus Protection Manager**: This product offers protection for desktops, laptops, virtual desktops, database engines, and cloud instances across platforms like Microsoft Azure, Amazon Web Services, and Google Cloud Platform. The VB100 Certification from Virus Bulletin underscores its effectiveness against malware and other cyber threats.

- **Data Identification Manager**: This tool supports organizations in identifying and classifying sensitive data, enabling them to migrate securely to the cloud as part of a cloud-first strategy. It uses a hybrid classification taxonomy, which helps organizations prioritize risk and identify security gaps.

- **Data Placement Manager**: This solution allows organizations to discover, analyze, and migrate complex datasets to Microsoft 365, ensuring secure and compliant data placement.

- **Data Archive Manager**: This product enables organizations to manage and migrate archived data securely, reducing the risk of data breaches and ensuring compliance with data retention policies.

- **Multi-Cloud Support**: Data443’s products support both commercial and open-source versions of leading Unix implementations on major cloud platforms, ensuring flexibility and compatibility in hybrid and multi-cloud environments.

- **Customer Retention**: The company’s 99% customer retention rate indicates strong customer trust and satisfaction with its security solutions.

**Benefits**: These features ensure comprehensive data protection, compliance, and flexibility, allowing organizations to secure their data regardless of location, platform, or format. The focus on cloud-first strategies and multi-cloud support aligns with modern IT infrastructure needs.

---

#### 2. **Compliance Certifications and Regulatory Adherence**

The content mentions the following compliance certifications and adherence to standards:

- **VB100 Certification**: The Data443 Antivirus Protection Manager earned the VB100 Certification, a well-known industry standard for antivirus products. This certification assures users of the product's ability to detect and remove malware without false positives.

- **Regulatory Compliance**: While specific certifications like GDPR, CCPA, or HIPAA are not explicitly mentioned, the company’s focus on data governance, privacy management, and secure data migration suggests alignment with major data protection regulations. Products like Data Identification Manager and Data Placement Manager likely support compliance by enabling organizations to classify and manage sensitive data effectively.

- **Industry Recognition**: Support from Gartner Security & Risk Management Summit 2022 for the Data Identification Manager product indicates that the solution meets industry standards and best practices for data security and risk management.

**Conclusion**: While the content does not explicitly list all compliance certifications, the VB100 Certification and recognition from Gartner demonstrate the company’s commitment to adhering to industry standards and best practices.

---

#### 3. **User-Focused Security Recommendations**

Based on the content, the following user-focused security recommendations can be derived:

- **Adopt a Cloud-First Strategy**: Use Data Identification Manager to securely migrate data to the cloud while identifying and mitigating risks.

- **Implement Multi-Cloud Solutions**: Leverage Data Placement Manager to ensure secure and compliant data placement across multiple cloud platforms.

- **Regularly Update Software**: Ensure all Data443 products are up-to-date to benefit from the latest security enhancements and features.

- **Leverage Antivirus Protection**: Use the Antivirus Protection Manager to protect desktops, laptops, and cloud instances from malware threats, ensuring robust endpoint security.

- **Use Data Classification Tools**: Employ Data Identification Manager to classify sensitive data and prioritize risk mitigation efforts.

- **Archiving Best Practices**: Use Data Archive Manager to securely migrate and manage archived data, reducing the risk of data breaches and ensuring compliance.

**Conclusion**: Users should focus on adopting cloud-first strategies, implementing multi-cloud solutions, and leveraging Data443’s tools to enhance data security and compliance.

---

#### 4. **Technical Security Implementation Details**

The content provides insight into the technical implementation of Data443’s security solutions:

- **Platform Compatibility**: Data443’s products support major cloud platforms (Microsoft Azure, Amazon Web Services, Google Cloud Platform) and hybrid on-premises/cloud environments. This ensures flexibility and compatibility with diverse IT infrastructures.

- **Product Integration**: The company integrates acquired technologies, such as ransomware protection and device recovery, into its product suite, enhancing its overall security capabilities.

- **Hybrid Classification Taxonomy**: The Data Identification Manager uses a hybrid classification taxonomy to help organizations identify and classify sensitive data, enabling better risk management.

- **Scalability**: The products are designed to support large-scale data migration and management, making them suitable for organizations with complex and distributed data ecosystems.

- **Multi-Platform Support**: The Antivirus Protection Manager supports various operating systems and environments, including Windows, Unix, and cloud instances, ensuring comprehensive protection.

**Conclusion**: Data443’s products are technically robust, scalable, and compatible with a wide range of platforms, making them suitable for organizations with diverse IT infrastructures.

---

#### 5. **Data Protection Measures**

The content emphasizes the following data protection measures:

- **Antivirus Protection**: The Antivirus Protection Manager provides robust endpoint protection against malware, ensuring data security at rest and in transit.

- **Data Identification and Classification**: The Data Identification Manager helps organizations identify sensitive data, enabling proactive risk mitigation and compliance.

- **Secure Data Migration**: Products like Data Placement Manager and Data Archive Manager ensure secure data migration to the cloud and Microsoft 365, reducing the risk of data breaches.

- **Multi-Cloud Security**: Support for leading cloud platforms ensures that data is protected regardless of where it resides.

- **Customer Data Retention**: The company’s focus on secure data archiving and management ensures that data is protected throughout its lifecycle.

**Conclusion**: Data443 implements comprehensive data protection measures across its product suite, ensuring data security, integrity, and compliance.

---

#### 6. **Best Practices for End Users**

The content indirectly supports the following best practices for end users:

- **Encrypt Sensitive Data**: Use Data Identification Manager to classify sensitive data and ensure it is encrypted both at rest and in transit.

- **Implement Access Controls**: Use Data Placement Manager to enforce access controls and ensure data is stored securely in compliance with organizational policies.

- **Regular Backup and Recovery**: Leverage Data Archive Manager for secure data archiving and recovery, ensuring business continuity in case of ransomware attacks or data loss.

- **Keep Software Updated**: Regularly update Data443 products to benefit from the latest security patches and features.

- **Adopt a Cloud-First Strategy**: Use Data443’s tools to securely migrate and manage data in the cloud, ensuring alignment with modern IT strategies.

- **Conduct Regular Security Audits**: Use Data Identification Manager to identify security gaps and conduct regular audits to ensure compliance with data protection regulations.

**Conclusion**: End users should adopt best practices such as encryption, access controls, and regular backups while leveraging Data443’s tools to enhance data security and compliance.
analyses.product:
### Detailed Analysis of Data443 Security Features and Capabilities

#### 1. **Key Security Features and Capabilities**
Data443 Risk Mitigation, Inc. offers a robust suite of data security and privacy solutions designed to protect sensitive data across various platforms, formats, and locations. The key security features and capabilities include:

- **Data Identification Manager (DIM):** A hybrid classification taxonomy platform that helps organizations identify, classify, and manage sensitive data. It supports cloud-first strategies, enabling rapid migration of data and user bases to the cloud.
- **Data Placement Manager (DPM):** A solution for discovering, analyzing, and migrating complex datasets to cloud platforms like Microsoft 365. It supports Unix implementations on major cloud services, including Microsoft Azure, AWS, and Google Cloud Platform.
- **Data Archive Manager (DAM):** A tool for archiving and managing data, ensuring compliance and reducing storage costs.
- **Antivirus Protection Manager (APM):** A new antivirus solution for desktops, laptops, virtual desktops, and servers running Microsoft Windows, both on-premises and in the cloud. It is certified with VB100 from Virus Bulletin, a prestigious recognition for antivirus products.
- **Ransomware Protection and Device Recovery:** Acquired from Centurion Technologies, this feature provides robust protection against ransomware attacks and ensures device recovery capabilities.
- **Hybrid and Multi-Cloud Support:** Data443’s solutions are designed to work seamlessly across hybrid and multi-cloud environments, ensuring data security and compliance regardless of the deployment model.
- **Global Product and Brand Visibility:** Data443 participates in industry events and summits, such as the Gartner Security & Risk Management Summit, to stay at the forefront of security innovation.

#### 2. **User Benefits and Protection Measures**
The security features offered by Data443 provide several user benefits and protection measures:

- **Comprehensive Data Protection:** Data443’s solutions protect data at rest, in transit, and in flight, ensuring that sensitive information is secure across all platforms and formats.
- **High Customer Retention:** Despite challenging economic conditions, Data443 retained 99% of its customers, demonstrating the value and reliability of its security solutions.
- **Subscription and Recurring Revenue Model:** Data443 is transitioning to a subscription-based model, which provides customers with predictable costs and continuous access to updated security features.
- **Ransomware and Malware Protection:** The Antivirus Protection Manager and ransomware recovery features ensure that users are protected from malicious attacks and can recover quickly in case of an incident.
- **Support for Business-Critical Data:** Data443’s solutions are designed to support business-critical data, ensuring that organizations can maintain operations without interruption.

#### 3. **Integration with Existing Security Systems**
Data443’s products are designed to integrate seamlessly with existing security systems, including:

- **Hybrid and Multi-Cloud Environments:** Data443’s solutions support hybrid and multi-cloud deployments, ensuring that data security is maintained across all cloud platforms.
- **Unix Implementations:** Data Placement Manager supports commercial and open-source versions of leading Unix implementations on major cloud services, ensuring compatibility with a wide range of systems.
- **Microsoft 365 Integration:** Data Archive Manager integrates with Microsoft 365, allowing organizations to migrate and manage complex datasets efficiently.
- **Gartner Security & Risk Management Summit Support:** Data443’s Data Identification Manager is supported by Gartner, indicating its alignment with industry best practices and standards.

#### 4. **Compliance and Certification Details**
Data443’s solutions meet various compliance and certification standards, including:

- **VB100 Certification:** The Antivirus Protection Manager has earned the VB100 Certification from Virus Bulletin, a recognized standard for antivirus effectiveness.
- **Gartner Recognition:** Data443’s Data Identification Manager is supported by Gartner, a leading IT research and advisory company.
- **Compliance with Major Regulations:** While specific compliance certifications are not detailed in the content, the focus on data privacy and security suggests that Data443’s solutions are designed to meet regulations such as GDPR, HIPAA, and CCPA.

#### 5. **Security Best Practices for Users**
To maximize the effectiveness of Data443’s security solutions, users should follow these best practices:

- **Regular Software Updates:** Ensure that all security software, including the Antivirus Protection Manager, is regularly updated to protect against the latest threats.
- **Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA):** Enable MFA for all user accounts to add an additional layer of security.
- **Data Classification:** Use Data Identification Manager to classify sensitive data and ensure that appropriate access controls are in place.
- **Regular Backups:** Implement regular backups and use Data Archive Manager to ensure that critical data is protected and can be quickly recovered in case of an incident.
- **Security Awareness Training:** Educate users about phishing, ransomware, and other cyber threats to reduce the risk of human error.

#### 6. **Technical Specifications and Requirements**
While specific technical specifications for each product are not provided in detail, the following information can be inferred:

- **Supported Platforms:** Data443’s solutions support a wide range of platforms, including Microsoft Windows, Unix implementations, and major cloud services such as Microsoft Azure, AWS, and Google Cloud Platform.
- **Hybrid and Multi-Cloud Deployments:** Data443’s products are designed to work seamlessly in hybrid and multi-cloud environments, ensuring that data security is maintained across all platforms.
- **System Requirements:** Specific system requirements for products like the Antivirus Protection Manager would include compatibility with Microsoft Windows versions, virtual desktops, and cloud instances.
- **Integration Capabilities:** Data443’s solutions integrate with existing security systems and platforms, ensuring that organizations can leverage their current infrastructure without disruption.

Overall, Data443’s security features and capabilities are designed to provide comprehensive protection for sensitive data, ensuring compliance with industry standards and alignment with best practices for data security.
analyses.user_guidance:
### Practical Data Security and Protection Guidance

#### **1. Security Best Practices**
- **Use Strong, Unique Passwords**: Always use complex passwords (at least 12 characters) and avoid reusing passwords across multiple accounts. Consider using a password manager to securely store and generate passwords.
- **Enable Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA)**: Activate MFA wherever possible, especially for critical accounts like email, cloud storage, and banking services.
- **Regularly Update Software**: Keep your operating systems, applications, and devices updated to the latest versions to patch security vulnerabilities.
- **Backup Your Data**: Implement regular, automated backups of important data to an external drive or cloud storage service. Use the "3-2-1" rule: three copies, two different media, and one offsite copy.

#### **2. Data Protection Recommendations**
- **Encrypt Sensitive Data**: Use encryption for sensitive data, both at rest (stored) and in transit (being sent over a network). Tools like BitLocker (for Windows) or FileVault (for macOS) can encrypt your hard drive.
- **Secure Cloud Storage**: When using cloud services, ensure data is encrypted before uploading. Use reputable providers that offer robust security features.
- **Limit Data Access**: Only grant access to sensitive data to those who absolutely need it. Use role-based access controls to minimize exposure.

#### **3. Safe Usage Guidelines**
- **Spot Phishing Attempts**: Be cautious of unsolicited emails, messages, or calls asking for personal or financial information. Verify the sender’s identity before responding or clicking on links.
- **Avoid Public Wi-Fi for Sensitive Tasks**: Refrain from accessing sensitive accounts or transferring confidential data over public Wi-Fi networks. Use a VPN (Virtual Private Network) if you must connect to public Wi-Fi.
- **Download Carefully**: Only download software or files from trusted sources. Avoid peer-to-peer networks and unverified websites.

#### **4. Common Security Risks and Prevention**
- **Ransomware**: Regularly back up your data and ensure backups are stored offline or in a secure cloud service. Avoid opening suspicious email attachments or links that could trigger ransomware.
- **Insider Threats**: Monitor user activity and implement access controls to prevent unauthorized changes or deletions of data.
- **Malware**: Install and regularly update antivirus/antimalware software. Scan files and emails before opening them.
- **Physical Theft**: Secure devices and storage media. Use a cable lock for laptops and store backups in a safe location.

#### **5. Privacy Protection Measures**
- **Data Minimization**: Collect and store only the data you need. Avoid keeping unnecessary sensitive information.
- **Dispose of Data Safely**: When disposing of devices or media, use secure wiping methods (e.g., DoD wipe) or physical destruction.
- **Anonymize Data**: Consider anonymizing or pseudonymizing data where possible to protect individual identities.

#### **6. When to Seek Additional Security Support**
- **After a Data Breach**: If you suspect or confirm a breach, contact a cybersecurity professional immediately to assess and mitigate damage.
- **Handling Sensitive Data**: If you’re working with highly sensitive data (e.g., financial records, personal identifiable information), consult with a security expert to ensure proper protection measures are in place.
- **Complex Systems**: If you’re managing complex systems or large-scale data storage, engage with a security analyst to review your setup and identify vulnerabilities.
- **Compliance Requirements**: If your organization must comply with regulations like GDPR, HIPAA, or CCPA, seek guidance from a compliance specialist to ensure you’re meeting legal obligations.

By following these practical steps, you can significantly reduce the risk of data breaches and protect your sensitive information. Stay proactive and remain informed about emerging threats to maintain a strong security posture.
